thread.title: Jailed pharmacy student's downfall through drug dealing an 'absolute tragedy'
thread.title_full: Jailed pharmacy student's downfall through drug dealing an 'absolute tragedy'

author: Hamish McNeilly
title: Jailed pharmacy student's downfall through drug dealing an 'absolute tragedy'
text:
Jailed pharmacy student's downfall through drug dealing an 'absolute tragedy' HAMISH MCNEILLY Last updated 14:26, February 15 2017 HAMISH McNEILLY/FAIRFAX NZ 
University of Otago pharmacy student Christopher Banks has been jailed after being involved in $100,000 worth of drug offending. 
A fingerprint in a pipe stuffed with drugs led to the downfall of an Otago pharmacy student. 
Christopher Banks was sentenced to three years and four months' jail for his offending when he appearing Judge Kevin Phillips in the Dunedin District Court on Wednesday afternoon. 
His lawyer, John Westgate, said the 22-year-old "had ruined his life up until this point". 
Banks had been doing well at the University of Otago, was well liked and respected, and had good family support. 
Westgate argued his client was "seduced" into drug dealing. 
"He jumped in boots and all," Judge Phillips said. 
"There was a large number of sales made by him for profit . . . he wasn't there as a charity institution." 
Banks' offending involved $100,000 worth of drugs, which he was selling to a "discreet group of friends", Westgate said. 
The charges, which he pleaded guilty to, included importing and possessing amphetamine, possession of steroids, and possession of a methamphetamine pipe. Ad Feedback 
Judge Phillips told Banks he was "an absolutely tragedy". 
The 22-year-old had a good education, good career prospects, and the support of a loving family and friends. 
Anyone "stupid enough" to follow his example needed to be deterred as drugs were a "scourge to the community", Phillips said. 
"When you were doing what you were doing you didn't give a toss." 
The court heard Banks imported a kilogram of ethyloneâ€‹ using the name of a tourist staying in Arrowtown. 
In 2015 he also supplied MDMA to flatmates, before coming to the attention of police. 
Police estimated Banks earned up to $133,000 dollars from his drug offending, and officers found hundreds of glass vials and caps at his flat. 
In July 2016, a drainage pipe containing a large amount of drugs and Banks' fingerprints was uncovered. 
Steroids, vials, cash, and a pipe used to smoke methamphetamine were found later. 
"It is serious drug offending," Phillips said. - Stuff
